fields.description:
*Assessment*

While verifying EUCA-9724, i ran into an issue where volumes attached to instance store-backed instances would never reach an 'available' state once DetachVolume was called.  The volume would stay in the 'detaching' state.  From the instance's point of view, the volume was no longer attached to the instance.  

{code}
# euca-describe-instances
RESERVATION	r-74f43774	548419658008	default
INSTANCE	i-9fbcaf37	emi-767918bb	euca-10-104-6-239.eucalyptus.rickross.cs.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-53-48.eucalyptus.internal	running	euca-admin	0		m1.xlarge	2015-04-09T19:09:21.158Z	HoodBillionaire				monitoring-disabled	10.104.6.239	172.17.53.48			instance-store					hvm			sg-30f7e497				x86_64
TAG	instance	i-9fbcaf37	euca:node	10.104.1.186

# euca-create-volume -s 6 -z HoodBillionaire
VOLUME	vol-ec83e76e	6		HoodBillionaire	creating	2015-04-10T04:40:43.302Z

# euca-describe-volumes vol-ec83e76e
VOLUME	vol-ec83e76e	6		HoodBillionaire	available	2015-04-10T04:40:43.302Z	standard

# euca-attach-volume -i i-9fbcaf37 -d /dev/sdf vol-ec83e76e
ATTACHMENT	vol-ec83e76e	i-9fbcaf37	/dev/sdf	attaching	2015-04-10T04:54:09.853Z

# euca-describe-volumes vol-ec83e76e
VOLUME	vol-ec83e76e	6		HoodBillionaire	in-use	2015-04-10T04:40:43.302Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-ec83e76e	i-9fbcaf37	/dev/sdf	attached	2015-04-10T04:54:09.807Z

## Confirm from within the instance that the volume attached ##

# ssh -i euca-admin.pem ubuntu@10.104.6.239
ubuntu@euca-172-17-53-48:~$ lsblk
NAME   MAJ:MIN RM   SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
sda      8:0    0   2.3G  0 disk
└─sda1   8:1    0   2.3G  0 part /
sdb      8:16   0  12.8G  0 disk
sdc      8:32   0     6G  0 disk
ubuntu@euca-172-17-53-48:~$ dmesg | tail
[35074.297863] sd 2:0:2:0: [sdc] 12595200 512-byte logical blocks: (6.44 GB/6.00 GiB)
[35074.299725] sd 2:0:2:0: [sdc] Write Protect is off
[35074.299732] sd 2:0:2:0: [sdc] Mode Sense: ad 00 00 00
[35074.300562] sd 2:0:2:0: [sdc] Write cache: disabled, read cache: enabled, doesn't support DPO or FUA
[35074.364721]  sdc: unknown partition table
[35074.390355] sd 2:0:2:0: [sdc] Attached SCSI disk
[35105.431848] mptscsih: ioc0: attempting task abort! (sc=ffff88003c4eb900)
[35105.431865] sd 2:0:2:0: [sdc] CDB:
[35105.431872] Read(10): 28 00 00 c0 2f 80 00 00 08 00
[35105.543941] mptscsih: ioc0: task abort: SUCCESS (rv=2002) (sc=ffff88003c4eb900)

### Detach the volume ###

# euca-detach-volume vol-ec83e76e
ATTACHMENT	vol-ec83e76e	i-9fbcaf37	/dev/sdf	detaching	2015-04-10T04:54:09.807Z

# euca-describe-volumes vol-ec83e76e
VOLUME	vol-ec83e76e	6		HoodBillionaire	in-use	2015-04-10T04:40:43.302Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-ec83e76e	i-9fbcaf37	/dev/sdf	detaching	2015-04-10T04:54:09.807Z

# euca-describe-volumes vol-ec83e76e
VOLUME	vol-ec83e76e	6		HoodBillionaire	in-use	2015-04-10T04:40:43.302Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-ec83e76e	i-9fbcaf37	/dev/sdf	detaching	2015-04-10T04:54:09.807Z

# euca-describe-volumes vol-ec83e76e; date
VOLUME	vol-ec83e76e	6		HoodBillionaire	in-use	2015-04-10T04:40:43.302Z	standard
ATTACHMENT	vol-ec83e76e	i-9fbcaf37	/dev/sdf	detaching	2015-04-10T04:54:09.807Z
Thu Apr  9 22:08:42 PDT 2015
{code}

*Signs*

Below are the log entries associated with the volume on the CC/SC/UFS/VMWareBroker machine:
{code}
# grep vol-ec83e76e /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log*
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Thu Apr 9 21:55:41 2015  INFO [BrokerInterface:VMwareControl.524] 10.104.1.186: BrokerRequest {DetachVolume: instanceId=i-9fbcaf37 volumeId=vol-ec83e76e userId=eucalyptus}
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Thu Apr 9 21:55:43 2015 DEBUG [VSphereEndpoint:pool-549-thread-1] Detaching iscsi target iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-31e1dd504-1c194346eee55275-vol-ec83e76e from host odc-d-39.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Thu Apr 9 21:55:44 2015 DEBUG [VSphereEndpoint:pool-549-thread-1] Sending message to SC to unexport the volume vol-ec83e76e
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Thu Apr 9 21:55:44 2015  INFO [BlockStorageController:pool-549-thread-1] Processing UnexportVolume request for volume vol-ec83e76e from node 10.104.1.186 with iqn iqn.1998-01.com.vmware:odc-d-39-5c07b853
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log:Thu Apr 9 21:55:44 2015  INFO [SANManager:pool-549-thread-1] Unexporting backend volume vol-ec83e76e mapping to vol-ec83e76e from all hosts
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:09 2015  INFO [BlockStorageController:Storage.19] Processing GetVolumeToken request for volume vol-ec83e76e
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:09 2015  INFO [BrokerInterface:VMwareControl.524] 10.104.1.186: BrokerRequest {AttachVolume: instanceId=i-9fbcaf37 volumeId=vol-ec83e76e userId=eucalyptus}
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:10 2015  INFO [BlockStorageController:pool-549-thread-1] Processing ExportVolume request for volume vol-ec83e76e
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:10 2015  INFO [SANManager:pool-549-thread-1] Exporting backend volume vol-ec83e76e mapping to vol-ec83e76e to NC host IQN iqn.1998-01.com.vmware:odc-d-39-5c07b853
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:16 2015 DEBUG [VSphereInstance:pool-549-thread-1] Setting scsi id 2 for volume vol-ec83e76e
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:17 2015  INFO [VSphereBrokerTaskFactory:pool-549-thread-1] 10.104.1.186: sending VSphereBrokerMonitoringTask [E i-9fbcaf37]: VolumeOpEvent [vol-ec83e76e, iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-31e1dd504-1c194346eee55275-vol-ec83e76e, result=SUCCEEDED]
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:17 2015  INFO [VSphereBrokerTaskFactory:pool-549-thread-1] 10.104.1.186: sending VSphereBrokerAttachTask [E i-9fbcaf37]: VolumeOpEvent [vol-ec83e76e, iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-31e1dd504-1c194346eee55275-vol-ec83e76e, result=SUCCEEDED]
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:17 2015  INFO [VSphereBrokerTaskFactory:pool-1881-thread-1] 10.104.1.186: receiving VSphereBrokerMonitoringTask [E i-9fbcaf37]: VolumeOpEvent [vol-ec83e76e, iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-31e1dd504-1c194346eee55275-vol-ec83e76e, result=SUCCEEDED]
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:17 2015  INFO [VSphereBrokerTaskFactory:pool-1881-thread-1] 10.104.1.186: receiving VSphereBrokerAttachTask [E i-9fbcaf37]: VolumeOpEvent [vol-ec83e76e, iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-31e1dd504-1c194346eee55275-vol-ec83e76e, result=SUCCEEDED]
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.1:Thu Apr 9 21:54:17 2015 DEBUG [VSphereInstance:pool-1881-thread-1] Setting connection string iscsi,equallogic,eucaprc,,-1,,,10.105.2.105,iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906-31e1dd504-1c194346eee55275-vol-ec83e76e for volume vol-ec83e76e
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.8:Thu Apr 9 21:40:43 2015  INFO [BlockStorageController:Storage.19] Processing CreateStorageVolume request for volume vol-ec83e76e
/var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-debug.log.8:Thu Apr 9 21:40:43 2015  INFO [SANManager:pool-22-thread-2] Creating backend volume vol-ec83e76e mapping to vol-ec83e76e
{code}

*Workaround*

N/A

*Steps*

# Install Eucalyptus 4.1.1 (4.1.1-0.0.23157.64.20150403git72f651b.el6) on the following setup:
#* CLC/Walrus/DNS
#* SC/UFS/CC/VMware Broker
#* VMware ESXi 5.1
#* Equallogic SAN Backend for SC
#* Networking Mode: Managed-NOVLAN
# Configure cloud as mentioned with workaround from EUCA-10721
# Bundle, upload and register an EMI
# Launch the instance
# Create a volume
# Attach the volume to the instance
# Once successful, confirm the block device associated with the EBS volume can be viewed
# Detach the volume
fields.summary: DetachVolume Hanging With VMWare Broker and SC Equallogic

DOC-1566 is the main issue - removing deprecated VMware from the docs.
Since we no longer support VMware, I'd like to close this, won't fix.
